div.style: background-image: url(http://odysseycharterschooldel.com/wp-content/uploads/2017/03/Building_Future_1219_BKG-uai-258x172.jpg);background-repeat: no-repeat;background-position: center center;background-attachment: scroll;background-size: cover;

div.p: Middle schoolers were given the building blocks to their future when OCS high schoolers visited them to talk about their experiences – answering questions about academics, athletics and even traveling to Greece!

div.style: background-image: url(http://odysseycharterschooldel.com/wp-content/uploads/2017/03/children-hands-in-odyssey-uai-258x194.jpg);background-repeat: no-repeat;background-position: center center;background-attachment: scroll;background-size: cover;

div.class: row col-half-gutter no-top-padding no-bottom-padding single-h-padding row-child limit-width
pos-middle pos-center align_left column_child col-lg-6 boomapps_vccolumn single-internal-gutter
tmb tmb-light tmb-bordered tmb-media-shadowed tmb-media-shadowed-darker-sm tmb-media-first tmb-media-last tmb-content-overlay tmb-no-bg
pos-middle pos-left align_right column_child col-lg-6 boomapps_vccolumn single-internal-gutter

div.p: Students from 10th and 11th grade attended the 9-day EF Tour “Grecian Odyssey” as the inaugural international trip for OCHS! Students visited Athens, took a cruise to 3 islands, the Corinth Canal, Nafplio, Olympia, Delphi and more! Students practiced their Greek ordering food, shopping, and interacting with local guides.

div.style: background-image: url(http://odysseycharterschooldel.com/wp-content/uploads/2018/07/1-1_Background-uai-258x194.jpg);background-repeat: no-repeat;background-position: center center;background-attachment: scroll;background-size: cover;

div.class: row col-half-gutter no-top-padding no-bottom-padding single-h-padding row-child limit-width
pos-middle pos-right align_left column_child col-lg-6 boomapps_vccolumn single-internal-gutter

pos-middle pos-left align_right column_child col-lg-6 boomapps_vccolumn single-internal-gutter

div.p: Chromebooks have been distributed to our high school students as part of our 1:1 Initiative. Each student has been individually assigned a touchscreen tablet/laptop for use in their classes. Students also take the Chromebooks home for homework and to extend their learning environment. We are excited to bring this 1:1 to all HS students!

div.style: background-image: url(http://odysseycharterschooldel.com/wp-content/uploads/2018/06/iStock-839295596-uai-258x172.jpg);background-repeat: no-repeat;background-position: center center;background-attachment: scroll;background-size: cover;

h2.span: OCS was awarded the Green Flag!

div.p: Our school is one of only a few schools in Delaware and in the country to receive the Eco-Schools USA Green Flag for excellence in environmental action and learning. This is the culmination of two years of hard work by our OCS community including a campus upgrade to LED lights, a school vegetable garden with 24 raised beds, our recycling program, and the tremendous efforts of our student advocates!

div.style: background-image: url(http://odysseycharterschooldel.com/wp-content/uploads/2017/03/children-hands-in-odyssey-uai-258x194.jpg);background-repeat: no-repeat;background-position: center center;background-attachment: scroll;background-size: cover;

div.p: We are pleased to announce that the “Boundless Journey Gala” held on February 2nd successfully raised over $110,000 to further the mission and vision of the school.

div.style: background-image: url(http://odysseycharterschooldel.com/wp-content/uploads/2017/03/ahepa-olympics-odyssey-uai-258x172.jpg);background-repeat: no-repeat;background-position: center center;background-attachment: scroll;background-size: cover;

a.class: custom-link btn border-width-0 btn-color-632047 btn-round btn-block btn-icon-left

h3.span: From the Head of the School

div.class: pos-top pos-center align_left column_child col-lg-12 boomapps_vccolumn single-internal-gutter

div.p:
Odyssey Charter School Community,
I am writing today to update our community regarding OCS’s plans and preparation to address recent health concerns. As you may be aware, the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention are tracking the COVID-19 coronavirus outbreak. The Delaware Health and Social Services has advised that for the general public, the immediate health risk from coronavirus disease is low.

Nonetheless, with cases of COVID-19 coronavirus reported in several countries including the U.S., Campus Operations Officer Riccardo Stoeckicht and I are developing a multi-tiered plan for potential episodic or systemic spread of the illness.

div.class: row single-top-padding single-bottom-padding single-h-padding limit-width row-parent
pos-top pos-center align_left column_parent col-lg-12 boomapps_vccolumn single-internal-gutter
pos-top pos-center align_left column_child col-lg-12 boomapps_vccolumn single-internal-gutter

h2.span: Investing in the Future of a Superior Charter School

div.p: Dear Parents, Staff and Friends of Odyssey,
We are working very hard to expedite the Gymnasium and Building 23 expansion by the end of this year, so that:

ul.li: All our students utilize these facilities for their Athletic activities and Holiday events

div.p: If we raise $400,000 between now and June, we will receive another $400,000 from the Reserve Fund, which would allow us to begin construction of the Gymnasium immediately!
Help us achieve this goal by visiting our website and making a contribution to the school’s Major Gifts Initiative! Read More

p.strong: Calendar 2019-2020 Download and Print | View On-Line

li.a: The redevelopment of the Pettinaro property on the Barley Mill Campus

div.p: In response to the evolving circumstances surrounding the COVID-19 pandemic, the Center for the Greek Language announces the world-wide postponement of the May 2020 Ellinomatheia Exams.
Please fill out the following form to register for shadowing at OCHS!

It is our great pleasure to inform you that the Greek language classes are starting on Tuesday, December 3, 2019. Classes will run once a week from 4:00 pm to 5:45 pm (there is a possibility of a 10-minute break) in Room #115 at the Middle School Building #21. The annual tuition fees are $300. This is a beginners’ course for those with little or no prior knowledge of Modern Greek. The emphasis will be on the development of reading, listening and speaking skills in everyday situations.
The OCS Board is seeking qualified individuals interested in applying to immediately fill the vacant Teacher Director seat on the Board. Read More

The School Board will meet every 3rd Wednesday of the month in the Lower School 2nd Floor Multi-Purpose Room, at 7:00pm. The next meeting has been scheduled for April 8, 2020 at 6:00pm. All OCS community members are invited to remotely attend.
The Compliance Committee will meet on February 27, 2020.
The Non-AHEPA Nominating Committee will meet on April 15, 2020.
Registration to the Childcare Program for school year 2019-2020 is now open.
